mdRecord.dcterms:title: East View of Mount Vernon.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Dillon, Luke C., 1836-1904
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Cabinet card of the east front of the Mansion from the southeast lawn. View includes the north colonnade and at the far left the "old lunch room" a temporary structure (1876-1885) used to feed visitors at Mount Vernon. Lunch service was suspended by the Association in 1885. The following text is printed directly onto the reverse of the cardboard mount: East View of Mount Vernon. Copyrighted by the Mount Vernon Ladies' Union Association. Luke C. Dillon, Authorized Photographer, Office at Pullman's Gallery, No. 935 Penn. Avenue, Washington, D. C.
